N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2815.2 - Program funds

State Regulations
(a) The program
funds shall be for administrative and planning expenses related to housing
preservation and community renewal activities conducted by the company, including: (1)
payment of salaries and wages
to employees engaged in housing preservation and community renewal
activities; (2)
fees to consultants
retained for housing preservation and community renewal activities; and
(3)
other costs and expenses
directly related to such employees and consultants, including office rentals, office equipment, fringe benefits and office expenses. (b) In no event shall contract funds be used
to defray the costs of construction, repair, renovation, rehabilitation, operation, demolition, clearance or sealing of any buildings or other
structures, except that such funds may be used for planning any such activity
and for preparing, furnishing, equipping and operating an office facility to be
used in connection with the housing preservation and community renewal
activities of the company. In such instances, the company shall, to the
greatest extent possible, make every effort to provide contracting and
purchasing opportunities to minority- and women-owned business enterprises as
defined under article 9 of Executive Order No. 21, issued August 4, 1983. (c) The company shall
establish and maintain a checking account with a bank or credit union to be
used exclusively for the deposit and withdrawal of funds received pursuant to
its contract with the commissioner. All withdrawals from such account must be
authorized by the signature of at least two individuals designated by the
company for such purposes, at least one of whom shall be a company officer. Copies of all authorized company signature cards for this account and any
subsequent changes to those cards must be promptly filed with the
division. (d) The company shall not
expend any program funds in activities engaged in for the purpose of attempting
to influence the passage or defeat of any legislation by either house of the

State Legislature. Notwithstanding the provisions of this subdivision, nothing
shall prohibit the company from expending program funds for the following
activities: (1)
the preparation or submission
of response to requests for information or comments by the State Legislature
concerning the company's activities, or the condition, population or needs of
the company's region, as such terms are defined in Part 2812 of this Title; or
(2)
the preparation and
dissemination of housing information to the general public. (e) The company shall not enter
into any contract, lease or other agreement whose terms or effect commit the
use of program funds for a period of time in excess of the term of the program
funding contract. (f) Payments
shall be made by the division to the company no less frequently than quarterly
to compensate such company for administering the housing preservation and
community renewal activities. Prior to payment, however, the division shall
have received all financial statements, progress reports and other
documentation as may be required. The division may withhold payments, if said
documentation is not acceptable; the division may continue to withhold payments
until such documentation is deemed to be acceptable. (g) The company shall maintain accurate
records of all financial transactions which relate to the performance of the
contract, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and make
these records available to the division on request. Notes
